blog.name: swpromptsandasks
blog.title: StarWars prompts and asks
blog.description: Send me your best (weird, nsfw and cute) prompts and asks for Star wars and if they contain Obi-Wan then hurray for me. Lets see what we can drum up. (I don't write for the last trilogy, apologies)

summary: ForceFavourite - How do the other Jedi react to the new Obi-wan's pet ? Who does not like a dog more? Yoda, Windu or someone...
question: ForceFavourite - How do the other Jedi react to the new Obi-wan's pet ? Who does not like a dog more? Yoda, Windu or someone else? Do Jedi like Quinlan or Depa avoid Kenobi?
answer:
“I have the strongest urge to scratch its karking head but I get the feeling it would bite my hand off if I tried that.” Quinlan said with a disturbed note in his tone, staring at the shape winding itself around Obi-Wan’s legs as the Jedi stood utterly still and let the Dark creature do as it wanted.

The fellow master’s words had Obi-Wan glancing down too though. “Right, yes. That does sound about right for it. It growls at people it doesn’t like and it outright barked at Pong Krell and Prosset Dibs for some reason.” He said in a pondering tone.

“Did it really pee on the Chancellor’s robes?” Quinlan asked with awed confusion. “Or is tha-”

“Oh no it did, though if it was urine or just liquid is as much your guess as mine,” Obi-Wan rubbed the back of his neck. “It really does not like the Chancellor.” He shook his head.

Anakin had practically been jumping out of his skin when that happened, the two of them having been at the Rotunda to investigate a few of the aids and terminals they could access to see if they could find some evidence to support Obi-Wan’s suspicions.

Obi-Wan had been doing his best not to laugh while confused Senator’s watched as a wet spot spread on the Chancellor’s red robe, the man yelping loudly.

“Force I wish I had been there to see it.” Quinlan grinned, his smile full of teeth as he rubbed his hands together as Obi-Wan snorted at him.

He had been doing his best to seem as serious as possible about the incident, especially when the council had questioned him about it.

However Quinlan suddenly went very serious, staring at him and Obi-Wan blinked at him in return. “What?” Obi-Wan asked in confusion as several initiates stamped past them on their way to a class with a few of them shooting the dark creature a nervous look.

Honestly so far most people had gotten used to it following Obi-Wan around even if it made them nervous.

“You and Skywalker have been hanging around the Rotunda a lot lately…” Quinlan stated quietly, crossing his muscled arms over his chest. “Do you need help?” The man asked bluntly, eyes serious.

“…You don’t even know what we’re doing.” Obi-Wan whispered quietly.

“Yeah but its you. You have a good reason for being in the Senate since you don’t like politicians on the best of days and there’s like maybe five you tolerate or are friendly with on Coruscant,” Quinlan grunted. “And my little ability may come in handy for you.” The taller man noted, wiggling his hand at Obi-Wan.

Inclining his head in agreement, Obi-Wan rubbed his hand over his face. “True… but if I bring you in on this, you will need to keep an open mind Quinlan.” He said seriously.

They both stared at each other before finally laughing.

Quinlan had fallen to the dark once and come back, of course he would keep an open mind.

()()()

“So we have Vos on our side too now?” Anakin piled the steak onto the plates, frowning a bit.

“Yes, Quinlan’s psychometry will be invaluable I will expect, his ability to touch and see memories of items,” Obi-Wa mused while mixing the salad for the two of them. “This all depends on if we can find out which one it is of course and figure out what Quinlan needs to touch that is.” He breathed out heavily.

Snorting a bit, Anakin nodded and started to drizzle the meat sauce over their steaks. “Maybe we’ll get lucky again, who knows…” He smiled wryly at his old master, watching as the redhead served up the salad onto two of the plates.

“Who knows but right now we have other things to do, like feed our padawan and ourselves.” Obi-Wan chuckled quietly and took the plates to the table.

Poking his head into the living room, Anakin zeroed in on Ahsoka cramming for a test under the window, sitting on a large pillow. “Oi Snips, foods done. Your steak is rare as requested and I put an ample amount of meat sauce over it.” He smirked when she gave a tired cheer, remembering his own days of study for tests as she dropped the pad in her lap aside and stumbled to her feet to join her human masters at the table, playfully teasing her masters about the oddity of eating leafs.

You have a good reason for being in the Senate since you don’t like politicians on the best of days and there’s like maybe five you tolerate or are friendly with on Coruscant,” Quinlan grunted. “And my little ability may come in handy for you.” The taller man noted, wiggling his hand at Obi-Wan.

Inclining his head in agreement, Obi-Wan rubbed his hand over his face. “True… but if I bring you in on this, you will need to keep an open mind Quinlan.” He said seriously.

They both stared at each other before finally laughing.

Quinlan had fallen to the dark once and come back, of course he would keep an open mind.

()()()

“So we have Vos on our side too now?” Anakin piled the steak onto the plates, frowning a bit.

“Yes, Quinlan’s psychometry will be invaluable I will expect, his ability to touch and see memories of items,” Obi-Wa mused while mixing the salad for the two of them. “This all depends on if we can find out which one it is of course and figure out what Quinlan needs to touch that is.” He breathed out heavily.

Snorting a bit, Anakin nodded and started to drizzle the meat sauce over their steaks. “Maybe we’ll get lucky again, who knows…” He smiled wryly at his old master, watching as the redhead served up the salad onto two of the plates.

“Who knows but right now we have other things to do, like feed our padawan and ourselves.” Obi-Wan chuckled quietly and took the plates to the table.

Poking his head into the living room, Anakin zeroed in on Ahsoka cramming for a test under the window, sitting on a large pillow. “Oi Snips, foods done. Your steak is rare as requested and I put an ample amount of meat sauce over it.” He smirked when she gave a tired cheer, remembering his own days of study for tests as she dropped the pad in her lap aside and stumbled to her feet to join her human masters at the table, playfully teasing her masters about the oddity of eating leafs.
trail.content:
“I have the strongest urge to scratch its karking head but I get the feeling it would bite my hand off if I tried that.” Quinlan said with a disturbed note in his tone, staring at the shape winding itself around Obi-Wan’s legs as the Jedi stood utterly still and let the Dark creature do as it wanted.

The fellow master’s words had Obi-Wan glancing down too though. “Right, yes. That does sound about right for it. It growls at people it doesn’t like and it outright barked at Pong Krell and Prosset Dibs for some reason.” He said in a pondering tone.

“Did it really pee on the Chancellor’s robes?” Quinlan asked with awed confusion. “Or is tha-”

“Oh no it did, though if it was urine or just liquid is as much your guess as mine,” Obi-Wan rubbed the back of his neck. “It really does not like the Chancellor.” He shook his head.

Anakin had practically been jumping out of his skin when that happened, the two of them having been at the Rotunda to investigate a few of the aids and terminals they could access to see if they could find some evidence to support Obi-Wan’s suspicions.

Obi-Wan had been doing his best not to laugh while confused Senator’s watched as a wet spot spread on the Chancellor’s red robe, the man yelping loudly.

“Force I wish I had been there to see it.” Quinlan grinned, his smile full of teeth as he rubbed his hands together as Obi-Wan snorted at him.

He had been doing his best to seem as serious as possible about the incident, especially when the council had questioned him about it.

However Quinlan suddenly went very serious, staring at him and Obi-Wan blinked at him in return. “What?” Obi-Wan asked in confusion as several initiates stamped past them on their way to a class with a few of them shooting the dark creature a nervous look.

Honestly so far most people had gotten used to it following Obi-Wan around even if it made them nervous.

“You and Skywalker have been hanging around the Rotunda a lot lately…” Quinlan stated quietly, crossing his muscled arms over his chest. “Do you need help?” The man asked bluntly, eyes serious.

“…You don’t even know what we’re doing.” Obi-Wan whispered quietly.

“Yeah but its you. blog.title: StarWars prompts and asks
blog.description: Send me your best (weird, nsfw and cute) prompts and asks for Star wars and if they contain Obi-Wan then hurray for me. Lets see what we can drum up. (I don't write for the last trilogy, apologies)

tags: oh Qui totally has feelings for Obi-Wan
summary: in Golden Petals, does Qui have any romantic feelings for Obi, or is Obi doomed? (and if he does have feelings, did he ignore...
question: in Golden Petals, does Qui have any romantic feelings for Obi, or is Obi doomed? (and if he does have feelings, did he ignore them because master/padawan dynamic? was he unaware of his own feelings??)
answer:
Finally asleep, Obi-Wan is curled up against Qui-Gon’s side with his feet tucked up under himself with a blissfully quiet mind and for a moment nothing feels like its changed.

Qui-Gon is the master and Obi-Wan is his twenty something young, comely padawan who had become a man of brilliant colors and mischievous spirit that sometimes just needs to karking relax because he was full of anxieties and warmth.

Beautiful and delightful.

But they are not on a ship on their way to a mission.

They are sitting on Obi-Wan’s couch, his dear Obi-Wan’s lips sporting a raw look from coughing up flowers and petals and Qui-Gon’s arm wrapped tightly around him along with a warm blanket that smelled of a musky kind of sweetness.

Settling his chin on top of Obi-Wan’s head, Qui-Gon breathed out heavily. “I don’t know how it came to this Obi-Wan. It doesn’t seem fair for the Force to return me now only to witness your passing yet that is what it seems like if you won’t tell me who you love…” Qui-Gon rumbled while rubbing the others side slowly.

He’d be more than happy to tear his heart out and serve it on a platter if it kept Obi-Wan alive and happy.

But neither of those seemed to lend themselves to this situation, the flowers coming from Obi-Wan’s lunges and filling up.

‘Eventually they will choke him, he’ll die with the taste of floral and metal on his tongue as the flowers block out oxygen, starving his body for air…’ Qui-Gon shuddered at the thought and outright pulled Obi-Wan gingerly into his lap.

He needed the reassurance of a still living man who had become even more beautiful than when he was Qui-Gon’s padawan, both inside and outwardly.

All that awkwardness of the young was gone, leaving behind a body confidant man with that wicked mind.

There was a swish which prompted Qui-Gon to look up as he ignored his throat itching, blinking at the entry where a blond was quietly hanging up a robe and removing his shoes.

Blond curls, blue eyed, a natural tan and tall…

A small smile grew on Qui-Gon’s lips at that.

Last time he saw this creature, he was at Qui-Gon’s hips with a bowl cut that hadn’t been very flattering.

“…Hello Anakin, its been a long while.” Qui-Gon greeted quietly so not to wake Obi-Wan, the rings beneath his eyes confirming he needed the sleep.

A hesitant smile was returned, a tenseness in the others frame that Qui-Gon put down to the man not being familiar with Qui-Gon, the boy having been trusting of the man who got him out of slavery. That boy was long gone and the Jedi master happily admitted he was excited to get to know the man Obi-Wan had raised.

“Hello Master Qui-Gon,” Anakin said in an equally quiet tone as he came over, looking at the two’s position but saying nothing as he picked up the empty cups on the caff table. “How is he?” He asked instead in a concerned tone, eyes falling on the bowl with flowers and blood.

“Coughing of course,” Qui-Gon swallowed heavily and stroked Obi-Wan’s hair, resting his hand on the other Jedi’s back to feel the beat of his heart, Obi-Wan’s breath already washing over the v of his tunic with every slow but deep breath.

That was a good sign, wasn’t it?

Anakin nodded slowly. “When he wakes, we got bacta mist for his throat… I’ll put these in the kitchen and go find them.” He murmured before padding off to the kitchen, his shoulders slumped as he disappeared.

The pose of a defeated man.

‘I can well understand that one… oh my Obi-Wan, dear love… the galaxy is cruel.’ Qui-Gon noted, ignoring the slight tickle in the back of his throat.

summary: in harmony of truths and silences
title: in harmony of truths and silences
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2GOXefB

by moranice

«Hoth is… all right, no description does justice to how unpleasant it is. Even in the confines of the cave air is biting with atrocious chill, and wind is blowing a vile snowstorm inside. Jyn’s ought to be offended at such conditions. But instead she finds herself walking up to Cassian, coming to a halt side by side with him, and remarking matter-of-factly, “We really need to discuss your definition of vacations, spyboy.”

Whatever challenges Hoth might have in store for her are worth the light and awe she sees burning intensely in Cassian’s eyes when he realizes that she’s not only safely back from her mission, but that she’s here with him.»

Or alternatively: a tale of memories and dreams, an ice planet, and a study in caring, conversations, and touches between two warriors who are learning how to love.
